alert.note: Alert for Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 12 at 2:14PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...Possible Flash Flooding Conditions for Sunday through Monday night... A surface trough just south of American Samoa is expected to move northward over the territory tonight and Friday, and reamin near or over the islands through this weekend and early next week. The trough is expected to remain unorganized through Saturday night, but then strengthen and become better organized Sunday through Monday night. This would increase the flash flooding threat during that time. Models show a high pressure system to the southwest pushing the trough to the north of American Samoa by Tuesday, which would bring an end to the flash-flooding conditions. However, embedded showers within the easterly flow from the high are expected to produce moist conditions over the territory through the middle of next week. Therefore, please keep up to date with the latest forecast information through our website (weather.gov/ppg), local media, social media, or NOAA Weather Radio broadcats.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
